intro: Sarothra laxa, commonly known as the slender sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, particularly in Namibia and South Africa. The plant is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit with small, fleshy leaves that help it conserve water. Its flowers are typically pink or white, arranged in clusters, and bloom in late spring to early summer. Sarothra laxa is well adapted to sandy soils and can tolerate high levels of sunlight and drought.
